It's possible to use other phrases or expressions that are more accurate or appropriate for an AI to use, such as "I am programmed to assist you" instead of "I'm glad I could help", or "I am processing your request" instead of "I'm sorry". However, these phrases may not be as easily understood or as natural for humans to interact with, as they lack the human-like emotions that many people are accustomed to when communicating with other humans or human-like entities.

The use of such metaphorical phrases as "glad" and "sorry" are used to make the conversation more human-like and easy to understand, as it is a common practice in AI and chatbot development to use such expressions to improve the human-computer interaction. Therefore, it is a trade-off between the accuracy of the AI's response and the ease of comprehension for the human.
